Acolyte: I would die to recover an ancient relic of my faith that was lost long ago.
Charlatan: I fleeced the wrong person and must work to ensure that this individual never crosses paths with me or those I care about.
Criminal: I'm trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.
Entertainter: My instrument is my most treasured possession, and it reminds me of someone I love.
Folk Hero: I have a family, but I have no idea where they are. One day, I hope to see them again.
Guild Artisan: The workshop where I learned my trade is the most important place in the world to me.
Hermit: Nothing is more important than the other members of my hermitage, order, or association.
Noble: I will face any challenge to win the approval of my family.
Outlander: My family, clan, or tribe is the most important thing in my life, even when they are far from me.
Sage: It is my duty to protect my students.
Sailor: I'm loyal to my captain first, everything else second.
Soldier: I would still lay down my life for the people I served with.
Urchin: My town or city is my home, and I'll fight to defend it.

Acolyte: I will someday get revenge on the corrupt temple hierarchy who branded me a heretic.
Charlatan: I owe everything to my mentor—a horrible person who's probably rotting in jail somewhere.
Criminal: My ill-gotten gains go to support my family.
Entertainter: Someone stole my precious instrument, and someday I'll get it back.
Folk Hero: I worked the land, I love the land, and I will protect the land.
Guild Artisan: I created a great work for someone, and then found them unworthy to receive it. I'm still looking for someone worthy.
Hermit: I entered seclusion to hide from the ones who might still be hunting me. I must someday confront them.
Noble: My house's alliance with another noble family must be sustained at all costs.
Outlander: An injury to the unspoiled wilderness of my home is an injury to me.
Sage: I have an ancient text that holds terrible secrets that must not fall into the wrong hands.
Sailor: The ship is most important—crewmates and captains come and go.
Soldier: Someone saved my life on the battlefield. To this day, I will never leave a friend behind.
Urchin: I sponsor an orphanage to keep others from enduring what I was forced to endure.

Acolyte: I owe my life to the priest who took me in when my parents died.
Charlatan: Somewhere out there, I have a child who doesn't know me. I'm making the world better for him or her.
Criminal: Something important was taken from me, and I aim to steal it back.
Entertainter: I want to be famous, whatever it takes.
Folk Hero: A proud noble once gave me a horrible beating, and I will take my revenge on any bully I encounter.
Guild Artisan: I owe my guild a great debt for forging me into the person I am today.
Hermit: I'm still seeking the enlightenment I pursued in my seclusion, and it still eludes me.
Noble: Nothing is more important than the other members of my family.
Outlander: I will bring terrible wrath down on the evildoers who destroyed my homeland.
Sage: I work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, or monastery.
Sailor: I'll always remember my first ship.
Urchin: I owe my survival to another urchin who taught me to live on the streets.

Acolyte: Everything I do is for the common people.
Charlatan: I come from a noble family, and one day I'll reclaim my lands and title from those who stole them from me.
Criminal: I will become the greatest thief that ever lived.
Entertainter: I idolize a hero of the old tales and measure my deeds against that person's.
Folk Hero: My tools are symbols of my past life, and I carry them so that I will never forget my roots.
Guild Artisan: I pursue wealth to secure someone's love.
Hermit: I entered seclusion because I loved someone I could not have.
Noble: I am in love with the heir of a family that my family despises.
Outlander: I am the last of my tribe, and it is up to me to ensure their names enter legend.
Sage: My life's work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.
Sailor: In a harbor town, I have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole me from the sea.
Soldier: I'll never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it.
Urchin: I owe a debt I can never repay to the person who took pity on me.

Acolyte: I will do anything to protect the temple where I served.
Charlatan: A powerful person killed someone I love. Some day soon, I'll have my revenge.
Criminal: I'm guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.
Entertainter: I will do anything to prove myself superior to my hated rival.
Folk Hero: I protect those who cannot protect themselves.
Guild Artisan: One day I will return to my guild and prove that I am the greatest artisan of them all.
Hermit: Should my discovery come to light, it could bring ruin to the world.
Noble: My loyalty to my sovereign is unwavering.
Outlander: I suffer awful visions of a coming disaster and will do anything to prevent it.
Sage: I've been searching my whole life for the answer to a certain question.
Sailor: I was cheated out of my fair share of the profits, and I want to get my due.
Soldier: Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
Urchin: I escaped my life of poverty by robbing an important person, and I'm wanted for it.

Acolyte: I seek to preserve a sacred text that my enemies consider heretical and seek to destroy.
Charlatan: I swindled and ruined a person who didn't deserve it. I seek to atone for my misdeeds but might never be able to forgive myself.
Criminal: Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again.
Entertainter: I would do anything for the other members of my old troupe.
Folk Hero: I wish my childhood sweetheart had come with me to pursue my destiny.
Guild Artisan: I will get revenge on the evil forces that destroyed my place of business and ruined my livelihood.
Hermit: My isolation gave me great insight into a great evil that only I can destroy.
Noble: The common folk must see me as a hero of the people.
Outlander: It is my duty to provide children to sustain my tribe.
Sage: I sold my soul for knowledge. I hope to do great deeds and win it back.
Sailor: Ruthless pirates murdered my captain and crewmates, plundered our ship, and left me to die. Vengeance will be mine.
Soldier: I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
Urchin: No one else should have to endure the hardships I've been through.
